content:
Diagnosis:
Endometrial cancer - Grade 3 endometrioid carcinoma, FIGO stage IB (T1bN0M0), POLE mutated

Treatment:
Total laparoscopic hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy 15 Jan 2024
Adjuvant chemotherapy - Carboplatin/Paclitaxel commenced 20 Feb 2024

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Pre cycle 4 Carboplatin/Paclitaxel

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is tolerating treatment well with minimal side effects. She reports grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only, which is not impacting daily activities. No significant fatigue. Appetite remains good and weight is stable at 72kg. Performance status remains 0.

Blood results show stable parameters with haemoglobin 115 g/L, neutrophils 2.8, platelets 178. Renal and liver function remain normal.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 4 chemotherapy today. We will see her again before cycle 5 in three weeks time. CT scan will be arranged after completion of treatment to confirm no evidence of disease.

cancer_timeline.value: Total laparoscopic hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

patient_facts.value: Blood results: haemoglobin 115 g/L, neutrophils 2.8, platelets 178, normal renal and liver function

status_updates.value: Early stage endometrial cancer post-surgery, currently receiving adjuvant chemotherapy. Tolerating treatment well with minimal toxicity
Grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only, not impacting daily activities
CT scan to be arranged after completion of treatment
Review before cycle 5 in three weeks
